lines.text: You ride off with somebody else's twelve million dollar horse, did you think we wouldn't notice?
You've had a hard day. Why don't you scrunch down in the bag?
Oh, I wish it were that easy. I don't sleep.
Ever? How old are you?
Albert Schweitzer. Franco... Albert Schweitzer.
I ain't carrying it. And you can't carry it.
The hell I can't. I've carried this stuff a lot of times.
Where? Up the escalator at Bloomingtons, or Bloomingbirds or where ever the hell it is?
Bloomingdales!
I've been to the rodeo. Twice.
Did you stay for the rattlesnake round up?
Yes. I stayed. Right till the end. I saw the whole thing.
They don't have one. How're you gonna round up a rattlesnake?
I'm just trying to be pleasant. You get so worked up about everything.

What have I got to be worked up about? I've only got a stole horse; everybody except the Coast Guard is after me; I've got nothin' but miles of open country to cross; and now I'm carrying a crazy woman around wearin' shoes from Bloomingbirds who thinks she's seen a rattlesnake round up.
They say breakfast is the most important meal of the day.
I know. I'm the one who said it.
I'm gonna get me a bottle of tequila and find me one of them Keno girls that can suck the chrome off a trailer hitch and just kinda kick back.
Mr. Steele, why were you 45 minutes late to the press confrence?
Well, I'd like to aplogize for that. I was giving mouth to mouth resuscitation to a bottle of tequila. And, we lost her too.
Hey! Hey, Hallie, Hallie Martin! We met in New York, remember?
Did we like each other?
Grace, why don't you stand in front of that poster with Sonny, and Steve can take your picture to bring home.

Oh, no, why don't you just take a picture of Grace in front of that picture of me with that box with the picture of me on the box holding the picture of me with the picture of me? Then you've got Grace, and you've got a whole bunch of pictures of me.
You're all bent. Are you sick?
Nope. Just bent.
I grew up gettin' up.
I knew a fella once misjudged a Brahma - put a rib right through his lung. He could barely breathe, and he still got up and rode the rankest mare there.
I will never understand why you find that kind of behavior admirable!
It'll get you up the hill.
I wanna thank you again for your help. There's not many people you'd trust $50,000 worth.

[pauses]
You'd better get up over the mountain 'fore it comes to me what I'm passing up.

[commenting on Sonny Steele's condition]
You look like shit... You're just walkin' around to save funeral expenses.
What are you gonna do tomorrow, Sonny?
Oh, I'm gonna get movin' on. Find me something simple. Hard maybe, but plain and quiet.
